notes: Islamic radical group attacks police stations

In successive days of violence between an Islamist militia and police forces, fighting surged on New Years Eve, when Nigerias government sent riot police reinforcements from outside Yobe state. As some civilians fled, one band of Al Sunna Wal Jamma fighters retreated to Damaturu, where they looted and burned a police station and a local government office.
Islamic radical group attacks police stations
Members of a militant Islamist sect who attacked police stations in Kanama and Geidam have retreated to a primary school in Geidam, to establish a base, raising flags bearing the word "Afghanistan."

Some 200 members of an Islamic group mobbed a police station in northern Nigerias Yobe State, killing one police officer; The incident occurred in Kanamma, some 240 kilometres (150 miles) north of the state capital Damaturu. The Mahairun sect, which came to the state from nearby Borno State three months ago, attacked another police station in Geidam where arms and ammunition were also taken away

A top official of Nasarawa State, along with several others, is killed during her visit to the polling booth in Kikyo, Toto LGA. The perpatrator is of the Igbarra ethnic group and the victim of Gwari. Many Igbarra believed the offical had been sent by the Governor to rig the election in their favour. Following the killing, there were further clashes in Toto and nearby Doma government council - many residents of the area were displaced, causing the military to enter the area and restore order. The of injured and dead from the clashes that followed are not known.
